prompt: Produce a short haiku about the physics of force.
response:
Force tugs on all mass
Vectors point, push, pull, and turn
Balance holds it still

prompt: Produce a short haiku about the physics of momentum.
response:
Snowball, rolling fast
Momentum guards its true course
Until friction bites

prompt: Produce a short haiku about the physics of acceleration.
response:
Speed shifts with time now
Acceleration wakes me
In each curved path wide

prompt: Produce a short haiku about the physics of velocity.
response:
Raindrop meets the wind
Velocity sets pace here
Direction, then drift

prompt: Produce a short haiku about the physics of position.
response:
Stars mark silent grids
Position tells where you are
Shift, and maps redraw

prompt: Produce a short haiku about the physics of gravity.
response:
Apple leaves the bough
Gravity pulls down through space
Curving lightâ€™s own road

prompt: Produce a short haiku about the physics of inertia.
response:
The cart keeps its stride
Inertia says stay same
Unless pushed aside

prompt: Produce a short haiku about the physics of rigid body.
response:
Edges do not bend
Rigid body spins as one
Stress stays inside long

prompt: Produce a short haiku about the physics of moment.
response:
Lever arm in hand
Moment turns the stubborn bolt
Torque wins at last now

prompt: Produce a short haiku about the physics of rotation.
response:
Earth turns through night slow
Rotation keeps the day bright
Axes hold the spin

prompt: Produce a short haiku about the physics of Lagrangian.
response:
Paths choose least action
Lagrangian guides paths well
Equations bloom out

prompt: Produce a short haiku about the physics of Hamiltonian.
response:
Energy kept safe
Hamiltonian rules time
States flow, unbroken

prompt: Produce a short haiku about the physics of motion.
response:
Dust in sunlit air
Motion sketches hidden arcs
Then rests in soft hush

prompt: Produce a short haiku about the physics of conservation.
response:
Nothing is lost here
Conservation keeps score true
From form into form

prompt: Produce a short haiku about the physics of constant.
response:
Stars keep steady laws
Constant stays, while we change on
Numbers anchor thought

prompt: Produce a short haiku about the physics of friction.
response:
Shoes scrape on rough stone
Friction turns speed into heat
Warmth trails behind us

prompt: Produce a short haiku about the physics of oscillator.
response:
Mass on a small spring
Oscillator hums in time
Back, forth, back again

prompt: Produce a short haiku about the physics of spring.
response:
Coiled steel waits, tense now
Spring stores work, then lets go free
Snap, and motion sings

prompt: Produce a short haiku about the physics of pendulum.
response:
Clock swings left, swings right
Pendulum counts each heartbeat
Period stays calm

prompt: Produce a short haiku about the physics of rocket.
response:
Fire roars below hard
Rocket climbs on exhaust thrust
Mass falls, speed rises

prompt: Produce a short haiku about the physics of frame.
response:
Train window, blurred trees
Frame sets what counts as rest now
And motion looks new

prompt: Produce a short haiku about the physics of non-inertial.
response:
Carousel spins fast
In non-inertial frames now
Weights lean to the side

prompt: Produce a short haiku about the physics of time.
response:
Sand slips through my hand
Time ticks, yet never returns
Only marks we make

prompt: Produce a short haiku about the physics of orbit.
response:
Moon loops without rope
Orbit balances fall well
Circles in dark space

prompt: Produce a short haiku about the physics of energy.
response:
Heat hides in a match
Energy shifts, never lost
Work becomes pure light
